thread.title: Meeting Street opens new learning center for children with special needs
thread.title_full: Meeting Street opens new learning center for children with special needs

author: Jusolyn Flower
title: Meeting Street opens new learning center for children with special needs
text:
WPRI Providence Meeting Street opens new learning center for children with special needs Jusolyn Flower Thu, December 5, 2024 at 11:22 PM UTC 1 min read
PROVIDENCE, R.I. (WPRI) — A Providence-based nonprofit is expanding its services to support children with special needs by opening a new learning center.
Meeting Street operates several schools across Rhode Island and Southeastern Massachusetts.
On Thursday, a ribbon-cutting ceremony was held for the 29,000 square-foot Mondor Early Childhood Building, designed to support children of all abilities from prenatal through age five.
Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement RELATED: Meeting Street getting $1 million for new Early Childhood Family Resource Center
Meeting Street currently serves around 4,000 children, and President John Kelly anticipates that number will grow.
“We added additional classrooms, additional meeting space for the community, so we’re really excited to open this today,” Kelly said.
Providence Mayor Brett Smiley highlighted the importance of early childhood development during the celebration.
“The reason that I am such a champion for early childhood is that it is 100% true, in education at least, that dollar for dollar the best investment we can make is in early childhood education,” Smiley said. “The more work we can invest early will pay dividends for the rest of their school career.”
Advertisement Advertisement The new building will also serve as a community hub, connecting families through activities and events.
NEXT: Khan Academy SAT prep now available to RI schools
